title: Self-Directed Microlearning Courses for Programming Systems Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Training process for in-service elementary teachers to acquire foundational programming system skills applicable to math education; accessible via mobile devices in BYOD environments, with self-directed learning structures beyond work hours

learning_goals: Within two weeks, learners can write simple mathematical visualization code using basic programming syntax with 80% accuracy
By the third week, learners can independently perform debugging using the system’s real-time error detection (monitorability) feature
By the end of the course, learners can create and share personalized study notes using provided educational materials (supplementability) and annotation features (annotatability)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
